main event: On June 12, 1947, a civilian reported observing an object that shot up and down in the sky, leaving a glistening trail, in Weiser, Idaho.
interesting points: The object exhibited significant movement, shooting straight up and down before leveling out., A neighbor confirmed the sighting and noted the object moved silently but left a vapor trail., The observed trail persisted for over an hour., The trajectory and behavior of the object are consistent with characteristics attributed to meteors., No photographs or physical evidence were available for the incident.
witness description: Civilians, including neighbors, who observed the object together.
